com.pb.sawdust.util.array

Interface TypeSafeArray<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type held by the wrapped array.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BooleanTypeSafeArray, ByteTypeSafeArray, CharTypeSafeArray, DoubleTypeSafeArray, FloatTypeSafeArray, IntTypeSafeArray, LongTypeSafeArray, ObjectTypeSafeArray, ShortTypeSafeArray

    public interface TypeSafeArray<T>
    The TypeSafeArray interface provides a wrapper for arrays so that they may be parameterized like other generic classes. A type safe array may be multidimensional; because of this, a number of convenience methods (sometimes leveraging the parameterization) for dealing with multidimensional arrays are specified.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Object getArray()
      Get the array wrapped by this instance.
      int getArrayDimensions()
      Get the number of dimensions in the wrapped array.
      T getValue(int... indices)
      Get the value of the wrapped array at a specified location.
      void setValue(T value, int... indices)
      Set the value of the wrapped array at a specified location.

    • Method Detail

      • getArray

        java.lang.Object getArray()
        Get the array wrapped by this instance.
        Returns:
        the wrapped array.

      • getArrayDimensions

        int getArrayDimensions()
        Get the number of dimensions in the wrapped array.
        Returns:
        the dimension count of the wrapped array.

      • getValue

        T getValue(int... indices)
        Get the value of the wrapped array at a specified location. Each index in the indices parameter corresponds to a location in the wrapped array's dimensions.
        Parameters:
        indices - The (0-based) location in the array.
        Returns:
        the value at indices.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of indices does not match the number of dimensions of the wrapped array (i.e. if indices.length != getArrayDimensions()).
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if any index in indices is less than zero or greater than or equal to the size of the wrapped array in the corresponding dimension.

      • setValue

        void setValue(T value,
            int... indices)
        Set the value of the wrapped array at a specified location. Each index in the indices parameter corresponds to a location in the wrapped array's dimensions.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to place in the array.
        indices - The (0-based) location in the array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of indices does not match the number of dimensions of the wrapped array (i.e. if indices.length != getArrayDimensions()).
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if any index in indices is less than zero or greater than or equal to the size of the wrapped array in the corresponding dimension.
